title: Why didn't Cassie get mana or mana regen buffs....
body: I checked the patch notes and realized that they left out Cass on the mana and mana regen buffs. As I remember Cass is pretty mana hungry and since mana pots have been removed she's been indirectly needed ( as if she wasn't bad enough). I opened this discussion wondering why riot didn't buff her mana or mana regens.

replies.body: Because instead of buying mana pots, Cass bought Tear and mana regen items.

True but you have to realize tear is a mid or late game item. This season matches usually end in 20-25 mins which makes tear a risk item because you may not be able to complete it. Other mana regen items are ok but she's still mana hungry and her mana runs out pretty fast despite the items you have. 

Overall I want to thank you for reading my post. It means a lot to me. <3 have a wonderful day.
750 gold {{item:3070}} as a  late game item?
It takes time to stack.  Gold value isn't the only thing determining when an item becomes relevant.

Sorry it was my bad. Let me rephrase that. When I mean by the tear being a mid to late game I mean the mana thing. Like the mana stacks. I don't know if I am doing it wrong or so but I usually get like 500 stacks around 15-20 minutes or so.
Even with game time lowered Cass will still be building tear. She is a late game champion, if games don't last long then she is bad
That's kiiiind of the point. She wasn't supposed to have a lot of mana early.

Riot hates Cass, there's no other explanation for this. She's been in a bad state for the majority of season 5 already and even after all that time they never considered buffing her. She's literally unplayable right now since pre-season heavily favors early game champs due to games ending after 20-25 minutes. You won't hit her lategame passive anymore nor will you ever reach a stage where you could even carry a game.

Also the overall nerf to ap-items made her life a lot harder, too. The same can be said about the buffs to mres on a bunch of other items which only serve to make mages obsolete.

That's what I believe too. I believe that riot hates Cass just as much as they hate Eve. Even though a Cass can go tear in lane to make up for the lack of the mana regen and mana buff she is still in a bad spot. They either rework her or give her some buffs to make her viable again.

Overall I want to thank you for taking your time to read my post. It means a lot to me. <3 have a wonderful day.

That isn't the only reason, or even a reason. 
Riot have already answered this question. They decided to look at number of mana potions bought to decide who they should give extra mana to. 
If the average player (I am assuming in high ELO) bought two or more mana potions when playing that champion then they would be compensated.
Cass players didn't buy two mana potions on average and so fell below the arbitrary cut off point.
Let's not forget a lot of marksmen have longer range then her twin fangs

How many threads...? Cass didn't buy mana potions anyway, because they don't help her. She could burn through a full stack and not really be any better off. She bought flat mana, and conserved her mana until mid game when she could reliably kill someone without running out (which, again, mana potions did not help with due to the speed at which she can use mana; she needs a large mana pool, not regen). She is better at this now, because Q and W do extra damage thanks to Deathfire Touch, meaning she doesn't need to spam E to win trades. The Dark Seal and the new Mejai's Soulstealer help her a lot, too.

> Cass didn't buy mana potions anyway, because they don't help her. 

Actually they did help her... since you know, spamming Q to get passive stacks and also stacks for your Tear eats up mana quite fast.

So don't spam. Really. Use W to get passive stacks and zone your opponent off of CS, and last hit with E whenever possible, especially things that are in your W. If you spammed with her and used _potions_ to sustain, you'd waste a _lot_ of gold.

> [{quoted}](name=Snake on bush,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=wcHGVTFT,comment-id=0005000100000000,timestamp=2015-11-13T20:50:00.719+0000)
>
> Well now you can't, since you will go OOM.

That was always the case. Spending 35g on 100 mana did not significantly affect that. It was a waste of gold. If you try to have your poison ticking at every possible moment, you _will_ run out of mana.

> [{quoted}](name=Snake on bush,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=wcHGVTFT,comment-id=0005000100000000,timestamp=2015-11-13T20:50:00.719+0000)
> 
> Using W for passive stacks is quite poor, since W is your main tool for waveclear when paired with E, and it has a long CD. It's good for zoning though, but the Q is the main poke tool.

They typically have to stand near their minions to attack yours, so their choice is either don't CS and let you push (and call for a gank), or take the poison. As for waveclear, a Q can hit a cluster of minions and prep them for free E on-demand much more effectively than the (as you said) long cooldown W, as long as you time it properly and use your autoattacks to control the health of groups of minions. Using W to farm minions is easier, because the longer duration gives you a bigger window for E resets, but Q is more efficient, because you'll spam it less prepping any last hits that do end up outside of your W than you will using it for poke. As soon as you have 900 max mana, 3 E kills will out-sustain one rank 1 Q. An unstacked Tear and a Dark Seal will get you there at level 5 with no mana runes. Flat mana runes will improve your early game considerably. Cass needs to be patient. Spamming is the wrong choice...at least until you're a late game face-melting monster.

It's already been stated that she will get looked at "next year". She didn't get compensation buffs for the removal of mana potions because buying those on her was always a bad idea in the first place.

It is true that cassie can manage her mana through E, but that does not help in trading at all, if you waste your mana pool in one trade (which is not difficult and wont kill anyone) you'll have to be afk farming with E for a looooong time to get half that mana back, and you cant trade anymore before that, the enemy laner will probably sustain up with pots anyways. So yeah, cassio early and mid game can be stupidly weak, also, imo, Tear of  the Goddess is a late game item, it really is not that good at sustaining mana early like {{item:3028}}. Problem with cassie imo is that her damage feels too poor compared to her manapool, if another champ like {{champion:63}} {{champion:34}} {{champion:101}} , etc... wastes its manapool in laning phase, the damage done would be way higher.

Then Cinderhulk was released, and it she ended up ripping through the jungle faster than everyone and crowding out every jungler in the game.

And after that domination, she got nerfed, her item got nerfed and now no-one plays her anymore.
